properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:19PM MST until January 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow MT
properties.description:
...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THROUGH AT LEAST THURSDAY...

.Wind chills of 20 to 40 below zero are expected at times from
this evening through at least Thursday. Areas near the Canadian
border may need Wind Chill Warnings eventually, particularly
Wednesday and Thursday mornings. Frostbite can occur in as little
as 10 minutes in these conditions, so make sure to dress properly
if you must venture outside.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero.

* WHERE...Daniels, Sheridan and Western Roosevelt Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this
evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced
visibilities. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
